introduction: Eure Aufgabe ist es, eine HTML-Datei namens timetable.html zu erstellen, die einen einfachen Stundenplan für eine Woche darstellt.

tests.name: Set the title tag to 'Timetable'
tests.feedback: The title of your HTML page should be 'Timetable'.

specs.title: HTML-Datei namens timetable.html mit HTML-Tabelle erstellen

tests.name: HTML file must contain a table tag
tests.feedback: Your HTML file does not have a <table> element. Please add a table tag.

tests.name: Include a table caption titled 'Weekly Timetable'
tests.feedback: Your table should have a caption (<caption> element) with the title 'Weekly Timetable'.
tests.javascript: (function() { var caption = document.querySelector('table caption'); return caption && caption.textContent.trim() === 'Weekly Timetable'; })()

specs.title: Setze die ID der Tabelle auf 'weekly-timetable'

tests.name: Set the table ID to 'weekly-timetable'
tests.feedback: The ID of your table should be set to 'weekly-timetable'.

specs.title: Erstelle eine Zeile für die Wochentage

tests.name: Create a row for the weekdays
tests.feedback: Your timetable table should have a row for the weekdays.

specs.title: Erstelle mind. 10 Zellen für die Stunden und Fächer

tests.name: Create at least 10 cells for hours and subjects
tests.feedback: Each row in your timetable table should contain cells for hours and subjects.

specs.title: Füge Tage zur Wochenüberschrift hinzu (Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday, Friday)

tests.name: Add days to the weekly header
tests.feedback: The weekly header should include the names of the weekdays.
tests.javascript: (function() { var days = ['Monday', 'Tuesday', 'Wednesday', 'Thursday', 'Friday']; var headerRow = document.querySelector('table tr:first-child'); var headerCells = Array.from(headerRow.querySelectorAll('th')).map(cell => cell.textContent.trim()); return days.every(day => headerCells.includes(day)); })()
